metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9385 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In driver_override_store of bus.c, there is a possible out of bounds writedue to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel AndroidID: A-74128061 References: Upstream kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-128.154
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1091.99
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1094.99
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1061.70
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1022.22~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1018.19~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1027.32
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-128.154').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.99').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1094.99').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1061.70').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.22~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1018.19~16.04.2').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1027.32').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
